name: Integrated Martial Arts of Utah
details: Our martial arts gym in Murray, UT specializes in the Bihonte (Bee-hon-te) Combativos System, which is a composite group of highly effective developed martial arts systems that combine to form a unique system of martial arts. The Bihonte system has as its core, five unique martial arts systems that each focus on various aspects of hand-to-hand combat. These five systems include Mokuraiken Kempo which is emphasized by lightning fast strikes and low kicks, Jeet Kune Do (Bruce Lee’s method of kickboxing and Wing Chun), ShihKeafma (Filipino Stick and Blade Arts), & Brazilian Jiu-jitsu/BJJ (specifically Pedro Sauer Gracie Jujitsu), and Hai Ki Chi Do (stand up Jiu-Jitsu), each of which was developed and practiced by various martial arts masters and founders who sought to develop one highly effective martial arts system that would incorporate and complement each of the individual systems and yet allow for effective fighting methods which incorporated a blend of striking, kicking, throwing, take downs, submissions, grappling, conditioning, joint locks, individual weapons training, and weapon disarmament. In addition to martial arts training the 54th Street Gym offers Fusion Fit training for men and women which is a unique form of heavy punching bag, focus mitt, thai pad, belly pad, shadow boxing, and plyometrics designed to use the body’s own natural weight for conditioning. It is an excellent way to get in shape, stay in shape, or improve your shape.
kids_program_detail: Looking for a fun, exciting activity for your kids? Check out our kid’s martial arts in Murray, UT! At Integrated Martial Arts, we believe that the foundation of martial arts training should be a broad one. Our children’s martial arts classes draw upon the same great sources for striking, kicking, grappling, and self-defense as our adult classes, but provide that training in a single, integrated format designed specifically for a younger audience. Students will learn grappling from Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, striking from Muay Thai, Kickboxing, Taekwondo, Kempo and Kali, along with self-defense courses, and anti-bullying skills, all in a format that is fun and safe for kids of all ages. We have several programs for kids. Beginners and Advanced as well as a class that is actually done with the parents if they choose to participate. The Beginner Kid’s/Jr. Grappler’s class is for kids that are 7-15 years of age and who have never done any martial arts classes. In the Jr. Grapplers program, we focus on 30 non-violent self-defense techniques that teach children to “neutralize and negotiate” with the bullies. Verbal assertiveness strategies are a major portion of this curriculum. A child needs absolutely no experience to start, and we guarantee a noticeable increase in your child’s confidence within a few weeks! In addition to the Gracie Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, we teach the kids a combination of punching, kicking and simple self-defense skills. The other group is the Kids Advanced for kids 7-15 that have achieved at least a gold belt rank and above. If your child trained in another martial art they may be allowed to participate in this class after an initial assessment period. We want to make sure that every student has a good foundation to allow them to progress with the other kids in the class. Kids in this martial arts class will engage in controlled sparring and grappling. The parent/child class is for kids 4-7. It is done once a week and is often done with the parent so that the parents can work with the child thru the week. We teach the kids basic self-defense techniques while instilling the foundational principles of leverage and control. The secret to the success of this program is that we make the lessons so fun that the kids beg for more!

name: First BJJ Center
details: Our mission at First BJJ is to equip our members young and old, male and female alike with the most effective self-defense/martial arts instruction in the world. We provide our students the necessary skills to defend themselves without punches or kicks in any real life confrontation. BJJ is a non-striking martial art. Our focus is to teach our students how to defend themselves by taking their opponents to the ground. By doing this, we become capable of defeating a much bigger and strong opponents through the use of leverage techniques that anyone, regardless of weight, strength or athletic ability, can learn. Another big difference between BJJ and other martial arts is how we practice fighting. Unlike other martial arts, with BJJ you have the opportunity to live spar every single class. The term we use for this is “rolling” and it a fun and safe way to try new techniques every day. If you are interested in trying Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, why not just come and join for us a few days to try it out? Professors Suyan Queiroz and Carlos Santos as well as many members of our team are more than willing to guide you through your first days in a fun environment.
kids_program_detail: It can be tricky finding a sport or martial art that will not only be healthy and a solid form of self defense for your child while also fun at the same time. Unlike many other sports the sudden impact or fast running across a field or even hard tackling of some sports does not exist in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. The more controlled grappling environment of BJJ can potentially reduce the likelihood of sudden heavy impact brought on from two individuals striking one another.
woman_only_program_detail: The ladies only BJJ classes are focused on providing a fun, safe environment for women looking to improve not only their Jiu-Jitsu but also their self defense. These classes are suitable for all levels, from ladies practicing BJJ for fun and a healthy lifestyle right up to those interested in competing. Please don’t hesitate to come and hangout with us to get a feel for our classes – you can even jump on the mat in your sweats to give it a go!

name: Krav Maga Reborn
details: Krav Maga Self-Defense: The most effective, real world, self-defense system that was originally developed for the Israeli military and is now the preferred system for U.S. military units and law enforcement agencies. At Krav Maga Reborn, we teach street self-defense using: punches, elbows, knees, kicks and anything it takes to survive. Defense against various strikes, chokes and weapons, and realistic training drills. Krav Maga is the official hand-to-hand combat system of the Israeli Defense Forces. Its quick counter-attacks and brutal offensive techniques make it the ideal fighting style for dangerous and unexpected situations. Krav Maga is not a traditional martial art, but a revolutionary self-defense program. Based on simple principles and instinctive movements, this reality-based system is designed to teach extremely effective self-defense in the shortest possible time. Attend our self-defense classes in South Jordan to learn Krav Maga and defend against common chokes, grabs, and strikes, as well as more serious threats involving weapons. The instructors at Krav Maga Reborn teach people how to function during the stress and shock of a sudden, violent encounter. Our mission is to prepare our students for any and all dangerous situations.
kids_program_detail: KMR Self Defense is the premier children’s program for Self-Defense, Kickboxing, Fitness, and Life Skills for kids ages 7 to 14. Our kids program gives your child opportunities to excel in physical fitness, safety, and self improvement. We emphasize discipline, focus, and goal-setting. name: Unified Brazilian Jiu Jitsu
details: Unified Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Academy was established in 2006 by a group of five Pedro Sauer black belts and friends who were among the pioneers of the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu scene in the greater Salt Lake City Area. Led by black belt Instructors, John Carlquist and James Gardner who have over 40 years of combined training and teaching experience, Unified Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Academy’s style of BJJ is based on highly effective self-defense techniques that can be applied in real-world scenarios and in a competition environment.
kids_program_detail: The Unified Jiu-Jitsu kids program is unique in the fact that every class is supervised by a Pedro Sauer certified Gracie Jiu-Jitsu black belt. Kids learn the fundamental principles of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, using technique and leverage instead of strength. Kids gain confidence, discipline, and respect. Our curriculum teaches them takedowns, escapes, submissions, self-defense and how to fall properly; essentially they become bully-proof. One of the challenges with learning many self-defense styles is in applying them to the real world. It’s often difficult to have confidence when the technique can’t be practiced in a realistic scenario. We provide our children a safe environment with constant opportunities and healthy competitions in which they can apply the techniques learned. Come see our large facility in South Jordan, Utah which is the greater Salt Lake Valley.

Rob has coached MMA athletes in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC) and many other MMA and grappling events.

MMA training for kids is a way to improve your child’s self-esteem, health, and sense of camaraderie with peers.

name: Universal General Mixed Martial Arts
details: Universal General Mixed Martial Arts offers a unique combination of five martial arts styles in Portsmouth, VA. These Styles are: Kyokushin Karate, Shotokan Karate, Bando, Olympic Style Boxing and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Furthermore, we offer individual classes in Karate, Olympic Style Boxing, and Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Finally, we provide a Mixed Martial Arts ( MMA ) class that focuses on the successful fusion of all the arts. As a result, we produce a complete and well-rounded Martial Artist. Our early instruction focuses on the importance of defense and not getting hit. All of our instruction focuses on real life application with a strong emphasis on avoiding conflict. Our goal is to encourage students of all levels to become physically and mentally fit.
kids_program_detail: Olympic Style Boxing - Our first youth mixed martial arts program is Olympic boxing (also called Amateur Boxing). The Olympic games showcase Amateur Boxing on a world stage. As well as many other associations. In our youth boxing class, you will develop boxing knowledge and boxing skill. Boxing knowledge consists of learning the objectives of boxing and how Olympic boxing is scored. Protect yourself at all times, hit and, furthermore, don’t be hit are the main objectives of Boxing. Scoring, however, varies depending on the style of boxing you’re doing. Lastly, you will learn physical boxing skills in our class. You will learn how to throw proper scoring punches through hard work, training and proper coaching. Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu - Our second youth mixed martial arts program is Brazilian jiu-jitsu (BJJ). Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is a martial art and combat sports system that focuses on grappling. Kodokan Judo ground fighting fundamentals was the foundation for BJJ. Takeo Yano and Mitsuyo Maeda Taught these skills to the Gracie family. Carlos and Hélio Gracie Created BJJ when mainstream judo took an Olympic turn. name: American Karate Escrima Association
details: An eclectic martial arts style combining principles of Karate and Escrima into a well-rounded approach to self-defense was established in 1987 by Mr. Glenn Harmaning.  He combined his extensive knowledge of Karate, Kenpo, and Filipino Escrima and Kali into a system which is based on the principles and dynamics of motion and physiology which encompass all the martial arts. The Japanese-Okinawan emphasis on strong, well-developed basic techniques, and the fast, fluid weapon and empty hand skills of Filipino Kali-Escrima form the foundation of the A.K.E.A. In addition, concepts from Chinese Kung-Fu, Korean Karate, Kenpo, Jujitsu, and Aikido can be found in A.K.E.A. techniques and skills. All instruction is geared toward use in and preparation for self-defense rather than sport applications. The A.K.E.A retains some of the most important traditions of historical Japanese/Okinawan karate out of respect for the history and contributions of those masters and styles who formed the very heart of the martial arts we practice today. We adhere to the martial arts traditions that foster respect, discipline, personal honor, loyalty, and a sense of lineage. Although the martial arts are often associated with Eastern religious philosophies, the A.K.E.A. finds value in preserving these traditions without religious affiliation. Other traditions that the A.K.E.A. preserves are: belt ranking traditions and practices, the bow of respect, the practice of forms (kata), standards of authority among black belt (Dan) ranks, the practice of breaking (tameashiwara), the practice of weapons along with the empty hand arts, and methods of sparring that differ from sport fighting due to their direct, skill-based application to self-defense encounters.

name: Category 5 MMA
details: Hey, it's James Johnson Jr. and I'm the owner of Category 5 MMA. I started my martial arts journey as a young kid. I was trained in Tang Soo Do by my father James Johnson Sr. As a teenager I earned my Black belt under the Universal Martial Arts Federation. I had a very traditional martial arts beginning that gave me the foundation I needed to be more disciplined and respectful. I wrestled in high school, but never won state. As soon as I turned 18 I enlisted in the US Army, and that's where my Olympic journey began as a Greco Roman wrestler. I'm blessed to have travelled around the world, met some amazing wrestlers I still call friends, and competed at the highest level. When I finally decided to move forward and become a Drill Sergeant to train our next generation soldiers , this is how I met Professor and Team Alliance Black Belt Andrew Chappelle. Professor Chappelle introduced me to art of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ). I'm proud to have the honor to train our soldiers as an Army Master Combatives Instructor. When I first opened this academy I had already been training hundreds of soldiers and civilians. In Martial Arts for preparation in real life situations. Watching our kids become so confident after training brings me a great sense of pride. I'm very deep into my Jiu-Jitsu journey, but I still focus on continuous growth. As a natural competitor in high level wrestling and martial art's I can confidently say this is in my DNA. As an owner of Category 5 MMA, I push myself to make sure you get the best instruction you can get. Most importantly I pride our academy on helping our students reach their goal. Let us know your goals and I'll make sure we do everything we can to make you our next big success story.

name: BJJ Olympia, Kickboxing & MMA
address: 1202 Black Lake Blvd SW, Suite E
details: At NW High Intensity Training Center, we believe that all of us can grow to be the best we can be through involvement and immersion in intense conditioning/athletic programs. Our aim is to provide you with all of the tools needed to meet your goals as an athlete, to become the best version of yourself possible. We focus on your learning and applying the best possible techniques, whether they are in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, Muay Thai Kickboxing, MMA  or in preparing for any of a myriad of other sports. You will train with goals in mind, not just to be the best at working out. We strive for long term health, functionality, maximum intensity, and realistic effectiveness. We support each other in reaching these goals as a family. We will provide you the tools and the environment to attain your personal fitness and training goals. The goals and focus are the same throughout the gym: Technical, Intense Training that is grounded on attaining maximum physical conditioning and results. Each new student is a welcome addition to our family, and as you progress, you will develop the skills and push the performance of your teammates. We focus on learning; we all become better when a new student improves. This is not a shark tank or a parade of egos: this is where we become better. Become the person you knew you could always be: physically, emotionally, spiritually…
kids_program_detail: In our Youth classes, your child will learn Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu in groups that are designed to meet his or her developmental and technical needs. Geared for students 5-17 years old, this class will teach your child the fundamentals of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu with emphasis on anti-bullying, self defense, physical fitness, and social skills in a fun and encouraging environment. Additionally, your child will learn self-discipline and cooperation, and develop self confidence and increased awareness. Learning to control an opponent, as well as learning to control oneself, are key goals in this class, as they are in life. This is real Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, not a martial arts class designed to instill a false sense of self confidence in your child while draining your bank account through a series of contrived promotions. Your child will learn real techniques in an environment that will teach them focus, attention to detail, and respect for themselves and others. The discipline your child will learn will be born out of being placed in an environment that requires him or her to be active, to lean the techniques, and apply them in a competitive yet supportive environment. Your child WILL have the opportunity to compete in tournaments once he or she has demonstrated the requisite skill and maturity. As with the adult class, this program is designed to have your child gain the physical and developmental skills to become the best athlete and individual possible.
woman_only_program_detail: Traditional Women’s Self Defense classes are ineffective because they generally require the student to recall a complex series of moves in artificial environments. This class, with its incorporation of approaches from a variety of systems, is unique in that it teaches threat assessment and stresses simple intuitive techniques taught with the goal of disabling and creating space and from a larger, stronger and more aggressive opponent. No complex movements, no athletic ability, or physical prowess required. Just bring yourself! It is recommended to take the course once a year to stay fresh on the skills you have learned. The following topics will be covered: Proper Mindset; Criminal Motives; Hardening Your Home; Automobile Safety. The students will then be introduced to physical self defense techniques designed to escape common threats. This is not a martial arts class, but rather a common sense approach to dealing with attempted physical violence and abduction. Physical prowess and strength are not required to effectively participate and accomplish these techniques. Techniques include: Hair and clothing counters; Arm counters; Choke standing/wall/ground counters; Weapon counters; Closed quarters (vehicles) counters.

The results of continuous practice of GB BJJ goes far beyond the benefits you will see on the mats. The discipline and standards implemented by our instructors are intended to carry over to the child’s behavior at home and at school. Our Future Champions Program is divided into in three separate groups to accommodate students of all age and skill levels: Little Champions I (4-6 years old), Little Champions II (7-9 Years old), Juniors & Teens (10-15 years old).

name: Gracie Barra Katy
details: The Gracie Barra School in Katy, Texas, was founded in October 2006 and offers world-class level Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu instruction for individuals, families, and Law Enforcement Officials of Harris County and is being developed to become a reference for physical education, character development, self-defense, and world class Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu training at the communities of Katy, Texas and surrounding neighborhoods. All Gracie Barra Katy classes are aligned with the Gracie Barra Program Structure developed by Master Carlos Gracie Jr. to meet specific learning needs from people with different ages, gender and levels. Our clean, friendly and progress oriented environment allows the students to have a challenging, inspirational and warm learning and training experience that always make them feel like coming back. Our school is for everyone and anyone who is looking to get in shape, learn self-defense, and improve the overall quality of their lives. In addition our family-oriented environment is a perfect place to teach your children to feel safe everyday not only when they are at school or outside playing, but also in developing their self-confidence and discipline. At our school, you will receive hands on attention from our world class instructors who will monitor your progress in a clean, safe, and family-friendly environment. Our Professors and Instructors were trained under the Gracie Barra Curriculum created by Master Carlos Gracie Jr. and their work is supervised by our Head Instructor and 3rd degree black belt Professor The GB Katy’s goal is training everyone with or without martial arts background and make them feel part of the Gracie Barra Family.
kids_program_detail: We welcome kids ages three to thirteen to learn the most effective self-defense martial art system ever created. Your child will receive certified Gracie Barra Black Belt instruction, personally overseen by Head Instructor and third degree Black Belt Professor Ted Stickel. Our classes are based on the curriculum developed by Master Carlos Gracie Jr. and will instill discipline, focus, and self-confidence in every child.

details: Gracie Jiu-Jitsu New Braunfels is an officially certified Gracie Combatives® and Gracie Bullyproof® training center in South Central Texas.

name: Team Legacy Martial Arts
details: Team Legacy Martial Arts believes in bringing out the best potential in each of our students. We do this through presenting challenges and goals, then guiding and encouraging them as they progress to black belt excellence. Team Legacy stands apart as a pioneer in the martial arts industry. We developed a system that holds firm to respect, honor and tradition, but also integrated bully defense, predator prevention, and ground survival tactics of Jiu-Jitsu. This one of a kind system offers a true path to a Mixed Martial Arts black belt. Team Legacy Martial Arts offers a variety of adult classes to fit a wide range of fitness and athletic goals. Whether you want to learn effective personal protection tactics, become a mixed martial artist, or just get into the best shape of your life, Team Legacy has it all. Team Legacy Martial Arts close quarter techniques stand second to none. We create high energy scenarios to best display real combat situations. Our unique blend of mixed martial arts including Tae Kwon Do, Judo, Jiu Jitsu, Kick Boxing, Muay Thai, and specialized close quarters combat, give our students a rounded comprehensive skill set that prepares them for any situation. Come and experience the team legacy difference.
kids_program_detail: Most jiu-jitsu schools have their youth students in one class, with some separating them into age groups. This is the only program that divides youth jiu-jitsu classes by their age and experience level. This ensures that children feel challenged and are having fun too. All kids start in the entry-level programs for their program. Once they’ve reached a certain maturity level, they’ll go onto the next training program.

name: Core Fight Academy
details: Core has been a long standing martial art school in Haslet, Texas and is a cornerstone of the community. We offer a large Kids Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) program with 2 kids classes: Tiny Kids 4-6 years old, Kids 7-13 years old, as well as a full adult program for 14 years old and up.  Classes are taught in Gi (Kimono uniform and belt) and NoGi (Rashguard and shorts or spats) on alternating days. This is done so that both styles can be trained and students become well rounded grapplers. We hold many Intensive Training Camps for kids during spring, summer and winter breaks as well as adult seminars from champion in the sport that are brought in by the staff.  Many siblings and parents train with us! We have a family environment and a drama free zone as soon as you step in our door. With a quality program, proven track record, happy students and people getting into the best shape of their life…Core is the place to be!

name: Epic Fight & Fitness Academy
details: Epic Fight & Fitness Academy is less like a gym and more like a family. We help you train with complete confidence knowing that you will be in a friendly environment full of encouragement and support. We are proud to work with people of all ages and abilities. At EFFA, our team is made up of a highly skilled and professional coaching staff, well equipped to provide value to everyone regardless of skill or fitness level. EFFA wants you to know that you can protect yourself and your loved ones when the time comes.
kids_program_detail: At Epic Fight & Fitness Academy, we believe the early years of your child's life can be some of the most important when it comes to the development of motor skills and character building. That's why offer a high-energy Kids Martial Arts program that uses the skills and strategies of both Kickboxing AND Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu to keep students active and help them learn something new every day. We train boys and girls all across Weatherford and Parker County. All experience levels are welcome.

name: Peak Performance MMA
details: Learn self-defense, build confidence, and get in the best shape of your lives! Martial arts has tons of physical, mental and social benefits, suitable for anyone and everyone.
kids_program_detail: Give Your Kids the Lifelong Gifts of Personal Success, Confidence, Discipline and Self-Defense...While Making Sure They Have a TON of Fun. Martial arts classes normally makes you think of self-defense, being strong, fit and safe. The truth is, it’s all that and WAY more!

name: John's Gym Temple
details: Located in the heart of Temple, TX, John's  Gym Temple's Jiu Jitsu Martial Arts program is the most credentialed Martial Arts Gym in Temple, TX. What makes us so different is our beginner friendly atmosphere. Whether you're a brand new person or a seasoned pro, we have programs and training partners  here to help you achieve your goals. Jiu Jitsu has long been known as the most effective form of self defense; it's also a fun way to stay in shape or get into the best shape of your life. Starting from day one, you'll feel more confident and secure with the self defense techniques you'll learn in our Jiu Jitsu class. John's Gym Temple's Jiu Jitsu classes are the perfect fit for anyone wanting to get in shape, learn self defense, compete or a combo of all three. John's Gym Temple is part of the largest independent Jiu Jitsu association in Central Texas with John's Gym Austin and Georgetown Jiu Jitsu as sister gyms. What that means for you is that as a member of John's Gym Temple, you can train at any of our sister gyms free of charge as well as enjoy the camaraderie when we do group trainings and events.​
kids_program_detail: We have a great group of quality kids that train here at John's Gym Temple. Our Kids Martial Arts classes will not only teach them how to defend themselves, but also create a more confident, respectful, and happy child, while giving them the tools they need to succeed in life. Imagine your child learning not just another "sport" but a well trained coordinated "art" teaching more about core values, fitness and self discipline while raising their self-esteem and encouraging a positive focus. Lessons and skills that they will utilize while maturing, laying the foundation for a happy, well-adjusted and fulfilled adult life. Our parents are so happy to find a Martial Art for their kid that isn't based on theory and breaking boards, but rather, real world self defense in a family friendly environment. We offer Black Belt instruction for your kid(s) with a combined 10 years of teaching  and whose main focus is to keep your kids safe and having fun, while learning self defense in a disciplined environment.

name: Team Shark BJJ
details: Team Shark, Daniel Pinheiro BJJ is located in Castle Hills, San Antonio, Texas. We are a family oriented IBJJF registered, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and martial arts gym.  We have classes for kids, adults, and even one on one private lessons. Led by gym owner Daniel Pinheiro, we strive to ensure that our students have a challenging and respectful environment to train.  Love, loyalty, respect, and honor serve as our core beliefs.  We are an inclusive facility and want to extend an opportunity for any one curious about the sport to come by and try a class. BJJ is a sport that transcends age and physical ability.  If you have a desire to learn we will match that with our desire to teach.  All we ask is that you come in work out clothing and are ready to sweat.
kids_program_detail: Kid's classes are for children ages 5-12. Teenagers generally attend adult classes, such as our Beginner BJJ class. In addition to staying active and involved in a sport, BJJ promotes respect and discipline and builds up confidence and self-esteem in kids. We have been told many times how our kids' confidence has prevented or stopped bullying or improved behavior in school. While no martial art or activity can guarantee an improvement in school, or bullying, or general behavior, BJJ has helped many of our students.

details: ​It's a way of life; a family. Not only will learn Brazilian Jiu Jitsu / MMA / Weightlifting from the best in the Brazos Valley, but you will get so much more.
kids_program_detail: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) is a fun way for children to get in shape and learn life skills, as well as real-world self defense. In BJJ, children learn: Discipline, Respect, Self Control, Coordination. They also experience the rewards that come with hard work and commitment! BJJ  classes will help keep your child mentally and physically fit with a combination of drills, work outs, grappling, and games.  As students grow, they learn to mentor younger students as an important part of their progression. Children are able to compete in tournaments after only a few months, but it is not required. This class is performed in the traditional uniform or “Gi,” which is provided as part of the BVMMA Intro Week.  For children ages 6-13.
woman_only_program_detail: The Women's Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) class is a great way for women to try out BJJ for the first time. It is a mixture of beginners and those who have been practicing a few years, so you will always have people to help. BJJ is one of the most effective forms of self-defense, as it enables a smaller, weaker person to successfully defend themselves against a bigger, stronger, heavier assailant by learning proper technique and leverage. ​In classes, you will be taught a step-by-step breakdown of specific moves and submissions. A typical Jiu-Jitsu class consists of: A dynamic warm up; An emphasis on instruction and technique; An opportunity to spar or “free roll” at the end (in order to get a chance to apply what you learned). Visitors quickly feel right at home, as Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is an empowering and addicting sport where you will grow as a person and find community. Most women will try a Women's BJJ class and end up staying for the mixed BJJ classes.  We have a very friendly and respectful community, so most women feel completely comfortable attending both.

name: First BJJ Center Riverton
details: Our mission at First BJJ is to equip our members young and old, male and female alike with the most effective self-defense/martial arts instruction in the world. We provide our students the necessary skills to defend themselves without punches or kicks in any real life confrontation. BJJ is a non-striking martial art. Our focus is to teach our students how to defend themselves by taking their opponents to the ground. By doing this, we become capable of defeating a much bigger and strong opponents through the use of leverage techniques that anyone, regardless of weight, strength or athletic ability, can learn. Another big difference between BJJ and other martial arts is how we practice fighting. Unlike other martial arts, with BJJ you have the opportunity to live spar every single class. The term we use for this is “rolling” and it a fun and safe way to try new techniques every day. If you are interested in trying Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, why not just come and join for us a few days to try it out? Professors Suyan Queiroz and Carlos Santos as well as many members of our team are more than willing to guide you through your first days in a fun environment.
kids_program_detail: It can be tricky finding a sport or martial art that will not only be healthy and a solid form of self defense for your child while also fun at the same time. Unlike many other sports the sudden impact or fast running across a field or even hard tackling of some sports does not exist in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. The more controlled grappling environment of BJJ can potentially reduce the likelihood of sudden heavy impact brought on from two individuals striking one another.
woman_only_program_detail: The ladies only BJJ classes are focused on providing a fun, safe environment for women looking to improve not only their Jiu-Jitsu but also their self defense. These classes are suitable for all levels, from ladies practicing BJJ for fun and a healthy lifestyle right up to those interested in competing. Please don’t hesitate to come and hangout with us to get a feel for our classes – you can even jump on the mat in your sweats to give it a go!

name: Renzo Gracie Utah
details: Renzo Gracie Utah is a martial arts academy located in the heart of Kaysville, Utah. We are right off the highway and easily accessible by public transportation
kids_program_detail: Cubs Class - A fun start-up for our littlest of fighters. Here kids from ages 5-8 will learn all about keeping themselves safe in a fight, as well as how to gently render an attacker helpless. Focus is the goal of this class. Simplicity is the key for these little ones to stay on track. Wolf Pack Jiu Jitsu - This class is challenging and fun. Children ages 8-13 will be pushed to their comfortable limits while maintaining a level of playfulness that won’t scare timid kids away. The main focus of the Wolf Pack is to build comradery and confidence in a safe setting. Students will learn how to dismantle attackers as well as how to avoid dangerous situations before they happen. Chokes and joint-locks are serious responsibilities to the children of this class. Wolves are not just dangerous, they are kind. The Pride Competition Class - Here we do not play as many games as in the Pack. Hard drilling, advanced moves, and working on details will help prep these students for tough competition. Sparring is more intense in The Pride and matches will be often held in a tournament style. Though the pressure on kids will be dialed up, we never push a student farther than their limit. This class is made up of Renzo Gracie Utah’s finest. State and National Champions will be in daily attendance. As a result, eligibility for this class must be earned. The Pride is invite only. The Jungle - A fun way to relax on Saturdays. Students of all three kids classes will come together to briefly review what they learned throughout week and play games to bring the team together. Sparring will be more relaxed on Saturdays. The jungle is a fun way to reward our kids for working hard all week.

name: Team Link Utah
details: Team Link Utah provides a number of training options in a family friendly environment.  Our team strives for excellence while providing a supportive culture that is competitive and fun. Our athletes compete often and do very well!
other_programs: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, Muay Thai, MMA, Boxing, Fitness
special_offer: We offer one week of free training for athletes to train and see if our school is right for them.

name: Mori Training Center
details: Mori Training Center is a martial arts school that teaches Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, Judo, Muay Thai Kick Boxing, and MMA (mixed martial arts). We are located at 3733 S 250 W Ogden, UT right behind the Newgate Mall. We are a family friendly facility. Our Jiu Jitsu academy is one of the few that teaches self defense Jiu Jitsu. You won't find a more welcoming environment to take classes.
kids_program_detail: The hunt for activities kids can be frustrating. There's no better choice than Jiu Jitsu. Classes will help your child learn structure and focus. One hour classes help develop strong problem solving skills as they learn to perform complex movements. Jiu jitsu requires a partner to practice this helps teach teamwork. The partnership will also help your child make friends inside and outside the gym. It will help them become more competitive and balanced through supervised sparring. Some people are looking for something to enroll their kid in outside of wrestling season Jiu Jitsu is an excellent choice. Classes will help students combine the explosiveness of wrestling with the strategy and control of Jiu jitsu. This activity is also a great release for energetic kids as it requires a good amount of physical activity this makes it great for their health as well as a good release for their frustration.

name: Park City Jiu Jitsu
address: 6430 North Business Loop Road, Unit D
details: Park City Jiu Jitsu has been in the Park City community for over 9 years, teaching the techniques, methodology, and philosophy of Jiu Jitsu. We offer our students the ability to learn world-class level instruction in a safe comfortable setting with a strong student base. Whether you are a beginner or experienced practioner, we have the ability to take you where you want to go.
kids_program_detail: Our Youth Jiu jitsu program teaches the basic concepts and techniques of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Our curriculum includes takedowns, escapes, submissions, self-defense and how to fall correctly. This program will bully proof your child and help them with the confidence they need in everyday situations. In addition your child will improve their coordination, flexibility, and motor skills along with improved memorization skills. We will teach your child how to learn and think under pressure and physical activity, while increasing their self-confidence. We instill in your child valuable life long skills, and a problem-solving mindset that will help them in all aspects of their lives. The primary focus of our Youth Program is to create a solid foundation of life skills from self-defense and anti-bully, to confidence and success.
woman_only_program_detail: Jiu Jitsu is the best self-defense system for women. It’s tried and true techniques are especially beneficial against a larger stronger opponent. These techniques are unlike any other system out there. Instead of relying on strength or unrealistic techniques like punching or kicking, we will show you how to employ leverage and highly effective self-defense techniques that can be applied in real-world scenarios. We will teach you to protect and defend yourself against an attack. You do not need any prior experience and can start the classes at any time. You will learn 30 of the top moves to defend against the most common attacks.

name: Gracie Jiu-Jitsu St. George
details: The only Gracie Academy® Certified Training Center in Southern Utah. What this means for you is that you get the highest quality jiu-jitsu education possible. We are certified to teach the Gracie Academy® curriculum which is standardized across every certified training center around the globe. As a Gracie Academy® student you also get access to Gracie University®, an online platform with detailed, interactive videos of each and every technique in the curriculum so you can practice and study at home or brush up on a lesson before you head to class.
kids_program_detail: Every month in the United States, three million children miss school due to fear of bullies. In the Gracie Bullyproof program, our goal is to instill in your child unshakable confidence so they can overcome bullies without violence. Due to the non-violent nature of the techniques, CNN, ABC, NBC, and Oprah have featured the Gracie Bullyproof program as one of the few effective counter-measures to bullying for children between the ages of 5 and 13. We will teach your child to use verbal assertiveness to deter bullies and several non-violent self-defense techniques to stay safe if physically assaulted. Importantly, we don’t teach how to punch or kick, since this often does more harm than good. Instead, we use leverage-based control holds to neutralize threats without violence. Numerous school districts have embraced the defensive nature of the Gracie Bullyproof techniques as a reasonable, nonviolent response to bullying and some even host Gracie Bullyproof classes on campus! The bottom line is: we will prepare your child to defend themselves against bullies without turning them into one. If you’re interested in instilling your child with unshakable confidence while reinforcing positive values and good character, the Gracie Bullyproof program is for you!
woman_only_program_detail: Women Empowered is the official Gracie self-defense program for women. In this 15-lesson program, we will teach you how to neutralize the 20 most common attacks ranging from having your hair grabbed to being pinned to the ground by a weapon-bearing assailant. Each one-hour Women Empowered lesson addresses two techniques. You can start the program at any time and participate in any class without previous experience. Unlike most self-defense systems that rely heavily on strength, speed, and coordination, the techniques in the Women Empowered program employ leverage, technique, and timing, so anyone, regardless of age or athletic ability, can make them work against larger opponents. Once you complete the Women Empowered program, you may test for promotion to Pink Belt!

Practioners build endurance, flexibility and learn time-tested techniques. These techniques make BJJ the most effective martial art in the world. Helio taught these skills and techniques to Master Pedro Sauer. Pedro Sauer is a 8th degree red and black belt directly under Helio and Rickson Gracie. Our PC Jiu Jitsu Alpine classes maintain a high level of instruction, along with top physical conditioning. name: Fairfax Jiu Jitsu
details: We are no ordinary martial arts school. Since 2007, Fairfax Jiu Jitsu Academy in Chantilly has offered the highest level of instruction in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ), Mixed Martial Arts (MMA), Muay Thai and Capoeira in Northern Virginia. Internationally recognized, full-time Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Black Belts and professional coaches with over 100 years of combined experience oversee every aspect of your development and help you achieve your goals. kids_program_detail: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) it is an effective, practical martial art that prepares kids to protect themselves in a self-defense situation. It’s also a fantastic way for kids to stay fit and learn hands-on about discipline, commitment, and teamwork. The program at Fairfax Jiu Jitsu accepts children from 6 to 13 years old. The Kid’s Jiu Jitsu program at Fairfax Jiu Jitsu is designed to instill confidence and self-discipline while improving balance, coordination, problem solving skills, and mental toughness. Each class includes a warm-up, technical instruction and an instructor-supervised drilling or sparring session. Students train both with the gi (uniform) and without as it is important to understand how to control your opponent in a variety of ways. Assistant instructors are routinely utilized to maintain a great student/teacher ratio on the mat. Martial arts is much more than merely mastery of physical skills. Children enrolled in Jiu Jitsu at Fairfax Jiu Jitsu Academy participate in the Forged Character™ program, a positive life skills and character-building program developed collaboratively with FJJ and a licensed teacher and curriculum specialist. Running concurrent with the Jiu Jitsu training, the program is designed to improve your child’s self-esteem, confidence, humility, discipline, and leadership skills. By working through the program, kids are able to advance on and off the mat, at home, at school, and in their community. The Forged Character™ program helps kids develop into disciplined, respectful, confident teens which make for disciplined, respectful, confident adults. This unique program is ONLY available at FJJ and reflects Fairfax Jiu Jitsu Academy’s belief that martial arts must be about more than fighting or self-defense skills. In the FJJ Kids Jiu Jitsu program, belts are awarded on a merit based system. All promotions are earned and are awarded based on sportsmanship, leadership, knowledge of technique and attendance. FJJ rejects the culture of the “belt factory” that some martial arts have become. We do not believe in “belt tests” in the traditional sense nor is there ever a fee for a belt promotion. Students are encouraged to be competitive when appropriate, but emphasis is placed on improving skills while maintaining good sportsmanship and peer leadership. Students in the program view peers as teammates rather than opponents. All of our kids classes are structured within a friendly and fun atmosphere. Professor Mark Jones is the director of the Fairfax Jiu Jitsu kids program as well as its primary instructor. He is an IBJJF certified 3rd degree black belt in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and has won numerous international competitions including a gold medal at the 2012 International Masters Jiu Jitsu Championships in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Outside of teaching, Coach Mark works with Loudoun County helping children and families as an attendance officer. Coach Sam Kim also teaches the kids BJJ program and is an internationally certified 1st degree black belt in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu with over 20 years of experience. Off the mat, Coach Sam is a mental health therapist and certified substance abuse counselor working in private practice with adolescents, adults, and couples. Set your child on a martial arts journey that will positively impact them for the rest of their lives! Begin the journey!

kids_program_detail: Here at Team Mannon BJJ, classes for children are structured, but without the traditionalism and cultural influences of other martial arts programs. Safety is our highest priority. Youth members will learn techniques and movement skills from Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu in a fun, non-aggressive and non-intimidating environment. The discipline and self-confidence that children acquire in our kids program helps them grow into well-rounded adults and empowers them to more effectively handle problems, including bullying. We acclimate kids to an active, healthy lifestyle full of character and self-esteem. Kids with character have powerful coping strategies for dealing with and resolving confrontations with peers. This class is designed to instill in our young students the values of self-confidence, physical fitness, discipline, respect and mental focus. Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) is a martial art, combat sport, and a self defense system that focuses on grappling and especially ground fighting. The art was derived from the Japanese martial art of Kodokan judo (which itself is derived from Japanese Jujutsu) in the early 20th century. It teaches that a smaller, weaker person can successfully defend against a bigger, stronger assailant by using leverage and proper technique – most notably by applying joint-locks and chokeholds to defeat the other person. BJJ training can be used for sport grappling tournaments (gi and no-gi) and mixed martial arts (MMA) competition or self defense. Sparring (commonly referred to as “rolling”) and live drilling play a major role in training.

Within a few months there were 35 members actively training under coach Joe on 300 square feet of cobbled-together mat space in a residential garage that was boiling hot in late summer and sometimes 30 degrees on winter days.  In spite of the hardship, new folks were showing up every week and it became clear that we were going to need a bigger facility to accommodate the interest in Joe's superior martial arts instruction.  Winchester Boxing was a natural fit and is now our home. The "Pit", as the original garage facility is known, is still used on special occasions so that new members can share in the experience.  As for the Shark you see in our pictures... well, you are going to have to train with us a bit before we give you the back-story on that guy.

woman_only_program_detail: Traditional women’s self-defense classes focus on maintaining a “safety zone” and going on high alert when strangers approach in a potentially threatening manner. And certainly, any martial artist will want to remain vigilant when possible. But women are most often assaulted by men they know, not strangers. The attacker is usually already within close proximity of the intended victim, and the fight will often take place in close quarters, perhaps in a vehicle or while sitting down, where the striking and kicking techniques favored by most self-defense systems are of limited to no value. There’s no room to throw a full force punch and possibly no way to utilize kicks. That is why Brazilian Jiu Jitsu is a great martial art for women’s self-defense. You will learn how to manipulate your opponent in close proximity.

name: Breakaway Jiu Jitsu
details: If you are looking for Brazilian Jiu Jitsu in Newport News, Virginia, then you need to visit Breakaway Jiu Jitsu. This is the place to learn self-defense, sport Jiu Jitsu or to just focus on overall health and fitness.  Our studio offers different age levels and class times to fit busy lifestyles. Called Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) because it was developed and refined in Brazil, BJJ evolved from Judo techniques and is similar to Japanese Jiu Jitsu, but it focuses on grappling exclusively by teaching “ground fighting.” No weapons are used, and there is no hitting. In ground fighting, a person has more leverage than fighting standing up.  A smaller person can more easily get the advantage over a larger person.  It brings the fight to the ground, where pressure, chokes, and locks allow you to take control and overpower your opponent. Brazilian Jiu Jitsu was instrumental in the formation of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA), beginning in Brazil as events called “Vale Tudo” during the 1920s.  BJJ is one of four grappling techniques used in MMA matches still today. The ability to participate in this sport is not restricted by sex, age, or size.  It can bring a feeling of confidence and security to your life.  Also referred to as the “gentle art,” it uses not only physical aspects but mental as well.
kids_program_detail: Breakaway Jiu Jitsu in Newport News, VA has Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) classes for kids. Why should your child learn BJJ? Body awareness: BJJ develops motor skills, balance, coordination, and neuromuscular connections. Socialization: Meeting new friends and sharing common experiences is a great way to learn how to communicate with kids of all ages as well as adults and authority figures. Confidence: As kids learn how to use BJJ techniques to overcome their opponent, they will be more confident in their ability to defend themselves and feel more secure. Fitness: What would be better than losing weight and having more energy and stamina? Having fun while doing it. Students don’t need to be athletes to begin classes. Everyone learns and advances at their own pace. Goal Setting and Completion: Improvement, completion, and earning that next belt motivates and encourages everyone to work a little bit harder. Self-Defense: BJJ is a real means of self-defense. In the United States, 25% to 33% of students say they have been bullied. Verbal and social bullying is the most common, yet some can lead to physical altercations. Although bystanders help in such situations, there isn’t always someone close by that can help. Martial arts have been shown to help children who deal with depression or the management of aggression. Initially, this sounds counter-productive, but the motor skills and control needed to perform Jiu Jitsu help children cope with these delicate emotions. BJJ is an effective outlet for children to channel aggression and excess energy. Kids need to learn how to win and lose gracefully daily. Motor skills are not the only benefit of Jiu Jitsu. BJJ will give children a better way to face fears and life challenges by focusing on developing behavioral aspects, such as discipline, respect, self-control, and confidence.

Come try us out and see how we are different.  We are confident that you will not be disappointed.

That being said we do not condone the intentional harming or bullying of our teammates or competitors. While Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is primarily a ground fighting style, all matches start standing up.  As a result, Judo throws and Wrestling takedowns are a part of the curriculum.  We also offer Submission Grappling classes which is basically Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu without the traditional uniform.  In these classes we typically wear shorts and a t-shirt or rash guard and there are no belt ranks. name: Gracie Jiu-Jitsu Fredericksburg
details: Although Gracie or Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) is the most effective martial art on planet, it is a relatively young martial art. Lacking a standardized curriculum, it is common practice, at BJJ schools around the world, for techniques to be presented in complete randomness. Each day, the instructor shows up to class, having no clue what to teach, and asks the students: “What do you guys want to do?” as if the students know better than he does, as to what should be practiced. Learning in such an unorganized environment can be extremely frustrating and overwhelming. New students almost always feel left behind since the techniques are usually tailored to meet the needs of the more advanced students. In most cases, students experience a sensation known as “Technique Overload” and end up quitting within 3 to 5 months of enrolling, and when they do, the instructor believes that the student’s lack of discipline is to blame. What they fail to realize is that when a student quits, the problem lies not within the work ethic of the student, or the techniques of the Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, but within the format in which BJJ is being taught.

name: The Basics Gracie Jiu-Jitsu
details: The Basics Gracie Jiu-Jitsu is honored to carry on the legacy of Grand Master Helio Gracie who wanted to share with the world the empowering benefits of the art he created and that his family continues to spread. The Basics Gracie Jiu-Jitsu has received GM Helio Gracie’s philosophy, techniques and principles through his second oldest son Grand Master Relson Gracie, to whom The Basics GJJ is directly associated. Furthermore, after a strict evaluation, The Basics GJJ became Certified Training Center by the prestigious Gracie Academy, directed by Grand Master Rorion Gracie (GM Helio Gracie’s oldest son), responsible of introducing Jiu-Jitsu in the United States. In an intensive course, the teaching methodologies developed by the Gracie family throughout three generations were passed on to The Basic’s GJJ head instructor, Marco Moreno. The Basics GJJ follows the tradition of excellence set by the Gracie family and is now proud to serve the Northern Virginia area. We invite everyone in the community, kids and adults (men and women of any age, size or physical condition) to join us not only to learn an amazing martial art but also to discover the Gracie Jiu-Jitsu way of life, a fun journey towards self-improvement and empowerment.
kids_program_detail: Children’s inability to stand up to a bully is rooted in profound fear for their personal safety. The victims know that they must confront the bully and would like nothing more than to stand up to them. But, they simply can’t follow through for fear of the physical harm that backs the bully’s every action. And, therein lies the challenge - how do you instill in a victim of bullying the confidence to face the tormentor, look them in the eye, and back them down? The answer is simple - teach the victims to defend themselves against physical attack, and the rest will follow. Most martial arts programs rely on striking the attacker with violent punches, kicks, knees, and elbows. In the Gracie Bullyproof program, we take a different approach. All the techniques are purely defensive and utilize no strikes. Furthermore, we teach children how defuse confrontations with words and never to initiate physical aggression. If attacked, we offer techniques to non-violently neutralize the threat and gain control until help arrives. In the Gracie Bullyproof program, we teach the children how to fight fire with water

name: Gustavo Machado Norfolk
details: Under Gustavo Machado, we are the most established BJJ program in the area. Brazilian Jiu-jitsu is a martial art and sport focusing on ground fighting and grappling. It utilizes leverage and technique making it possible to defeat bigger, stronger opponents. BJJ has been proven to be extremely effective since most fights eventually end up on the ground. BJJ has enjoyed explosive popularity with its great success in the UFC and other Mixed Martial Arts events. It can be trained for self defense, sport grappling and MMA training. BJJ is in the training regiment of every successful martial artist worldwide. Translated as “the gentle art”, BJJ focuses on using leverage, technique and positioning to overcome size, strength and aggression. With roots from Japanese Jujutsu from the late 19th century, the art made its way to Brazil in 1910. Here, the Gracie family modified and refined the art and tested it against other styles with great success thus creating the tradition known worldwide. Gustavo Machado BJJ continues this proud tradition as he brought his knowledge and expertise to Virginia in 1998. Studying under Jean Jaques Machado, Carlos Gracie Jr. and Roberto “Gordo” Correa, Gustavo has dedicated his life to teaching BJJ. He operates the main academy in Virginia Beach and is also the President and founder of the Virginia Brazilian Jiu-jitsu Federation. details: The Top Game Academy is an official training center of Gracie Jiu-jitsu Black Belt Gustavo Machado. Gustavo hails out of the world famous Gracie Barra Academy of Brazil. Our goal is to see everyone reach his or her maximum potential as quickly and safely as possible. We believe that this type of training environment is what makes the Top Game Academy the best place to train in the Richmond, Virginia area. Whatever your reason for training in Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, whether it be for self- defense, competition, or fitness, the Top Game Academy offers training to suit a variety of needs. We are dedicated to providing you with the best training experience possible, while teaching you the most effective fighting techniques available today.
kids_program_detail: The practice of Brazilian Jiu-jitsu improves focus, coordination, physical fitness, self-esteem, and builds character. This is all accomplished in a fun and exciting training environment. Top Game teaches our students the world’s most effective form of self-defense. Students become empowered to handle problems, including bullying. They acquire crucial tools needed to effectively defuse a threatening situation before it escalates. Most importantly, our students can easily defend themselves against physical aggression. Success on the mat leads to success in school, social settings, and in life. Every parent wants the best for their child. Top Game Jiu-jitsu provides them with the opportunity to cultivate all of the attributes needed to be successful and happy. Why should I choose Brazilian Jiu-jitsu for my child, instead of other martial arts? Brazilian Jiu-jitsu has been proven to be the most effective form of unarmed combat and self-defense, when compared to all other martial arts. The techniques allow for realistic practice, against a fully resisting opponent, without the fear of sustaining injuries. The essence of Brazilian Jiu-jitsu is to take the stronger, more athletic and physically aggressive opponent out of his element and into the clinch and ground phase of an altercation, where his advantages can be nullified. Most martial arts never even address this part of an altercation… Brazilian Jiu-jitsu specializes in it! Children naturally like to be rough and tumble… When you put them together for play, they’ll more often than not start wrestling. It’s a natural thing for kids to want to grab, push, pull, tackle and grapple, so most kids easily take to training in Brazilian Jiu-jitsu. With Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, there are no fancy jump or spinning kicks, no useless forms to remember, just effective techniques that have been proven to work time and again in real situations.

kids_program_detail: Junior and Teen Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (ages 7 – 14): Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu is a form of wrestling that is perfect for active, “hands-on” kids who need a safe, sportsman-like, and vigorous outlet for their energy. Because it does not include punching, kicking, or striking techniques, Junior Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu allows students to safely spar with a more realistic level of resistance than they could with impact martial arts such as Karate or Taekwon-Do. This makes for a faster learning curve for self-defense skills, development of physical confidence, and overall proficiency. woman_only_program_detail: ThinkSafe for Women (ages 14 and up) - This program teaches a practical and common-sense approach to personal protection for women in a short amount of time and training. Simple, effective physical techniques are combined with vital tactical and strategic training designed to help prevent the need for the use of physical skills. Exertion is minimal to light. Research has shown that attackers will exhibit certain behaviors and look for certain traits in their victims. ThinkSafe teaches both how to project an image of non-vulnerability and how to perceive and deter potential attacks before they become physical. In the event of a physical attack, ThinkSafe techniques are simple and practical, designed to achieve maximum effect with a minimal amount of training. Since the schedule for ThinkSafe classes varies, please contact us about future trainings or about scheduling a custom workshop for you or your organization. Martial Way also recommends women self-defense trainings with The Safety Team, a non-profit organization comprised of seven highly-skilled women martial artists. This team has participated in Martial Way’s ThinkSafe Self-Defense Program, first as students and later as instructors. They have also earned black belt rank with Martial Way in Kempo-Jujitsu and Arnis de Mano and advance rank in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and Bushintai-Do.
